= Heritage and Langauge Families and Groups =
WtWSMS integrates the [https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2776681880 Community Culture Utility] by Vertimnus, adding more granularity to languages and cultures in CK3.

From CCU's Steam Page:

<code>
* Cultures with a shared heritage group/family have increased baseline cultural acceptance
* Cultures with a shared language group/family have increased baseline cultural acceptance
* Languages in the same group/family as your native language are easier to learn
* AI prefers to adopt more closely related languages
* AI prefers to adopt court languages more closely related to their native tongue
* No performance cost - all the heavy computations are done at game start
</code>

Sharing a heritage implies a <span style="color:#005000">'''+20'''</span> baseline acceptance, while sharing a heritage group imples a <span style="color:#005000">'''+10'''</span> base acceptance, and sharing a heritage family implies a <span style="color:#005000">'''+5'''</span> baseline acceptance.

For languages, a shared language implies a <span style="color:#005000">'''+12'''</span> base acceptance, a shared language group a <span style="color:#005000">'''+6'''</span> base acceptance, and a shared language family a <span style="color:#005000">'''+3'''</span> base acceptance. Additionally, certain cultures have [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprachbund Language Unions], which allow [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_relationship_(linguistics) genetically unrelated] languages to have a <span style="color:#005000">'''+3'''</span> baseline acceptance despite their lack of relationship. Currently, this applies to the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turco-Mongol_tradition Steppe-Siberian] group and the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Languages_of_the_Caucasus Caucasian Langauges].
